results.title: Charm school
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
Another in the series following the development of Australian art and artists. Robert Hughes discusses the work of Russell Drysdale, Donald Friend, Jean Bellette, Paul Haeflinger, David Strachan, William Dobell, Justin O’Brien, Sali Herman, Lloyd Rees, and Geoffrey Smart. Written and narrated by Robert Hughes.

results.title: The Angry decade (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. A look at Australia’s ‘angry young men’ - painters of the Depression Era: Danila Vassilieff, Sidney Nolan, Albert Tucker, John Perceval and Arthur Boyd. Narrated by Robert Hughes.

results.title: Modernism
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. Post impressionism raised its timid head in Australia around 1915 but started with a disadvantage - rampant nationalism made it an unreceptive age for the brave new visions of Margaret Preston, Grace Cossington-Smith, Roland Wakelin and Roy de Maistre. Narrated by Robert Hughes Suitable for upper secondary level

results.title: The Fat young nymphs
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. In the years up to the end of World War I, Australian artists made a concerted effort to impress themselves on the world at large. Hughes looks at the work of Norman Lindsay, Sydney Long, George Lambert, Hugh Ramsay, Emmanuel Phillips Fox, Rupert Bunny and sculptor Bertram McKennal.

results.title: The Mateship commune (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. The story of the few years that have become known as the “Golden Age” of Australian painting. Impressionism was founded by Tom Roberts, Arthur Streeton, Frederick McCubbin and Charles Conder; The Heidelberg School.

results.title: The Mateship commune
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. The story of the few years that have become known as the “Golden Age” of Australian painting. Impressionism was founded by Tom Roberts, Arthur Streeton, Frederick McCubbin and Charles Conder; The Heidelberg School. Narrated by Robert Hughes. Photography by Tony Wilson.

results.title: Mutton and gold
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. The change from a Provincial Georgian culture into Victoriana when free settlers and ‘mutton and gold’ changed everythingin Australia including its art. Works include T.S. Gill on the goldfields, the vast history of painting of William Strutt and the landscapes of Eugene von Guerard, Nicholas Chevalier, William Piguenit, S.T. Gill and Louis Buvelot. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Chains of arcady
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. Covers mainly the convict artists of Australia’s early days. Discusses the works of Thomas Watling, Joseph Lycett, Conrad Martens, John Glover, William Gould, Augustus Earle and Thomas Boch. Commentary by Robert Hughes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Antipodeans
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. Arthur Boyd and John Perceval had progressed through the ‘angry decade’ and younger painters joined them: Robert Dickerson, Charles Blackman, John Brack, Clifton Pugh and David Boyd, and two greats who were to influence the future, Sidney Nolan and Leonard French.
results.description:
